greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: T(n,m) is the number of (directed) Hamiltonian paths in K_n X K_m.
comment: Equivalently, the number of directed Hamiltonian paths on the n X m rook graph.
Conjecture: T(n,m) mod n!*m! = 0. - _Mikhail Kurkov_, Feb 08 2019

The above conjecture is true since a path defines an ordering on the rows and columns by the order in which they are first visited by the path. Every permutation of rows and columns therefore gives a different path. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Feb 08 2021
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..96
